alert.note: Alert for Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:41AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Sussex County through 815 AM EDT... At 740 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pellettown, or 9 miles northeast of Newton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montague, Franklin, Hamburg, Ogdensburg, Sussex, Branchville, High Point, Vernon Valley, Pellettown, Crandon Lakes, Highland Lake, Hainesville and Lake Mohawk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
